name: ctrl
description:
Control service is always service index `0`.
It handles actions common to all services on a device.

contents.name: services
contents.description:
The `restart_counter` starts at `0x1` and increments by one until it reaches `0xf`, then it stays at `0xf`.
If this number ever goes down, it indicates that the device restarted.
The upper 4 bits of `restart_counter` are reserved.
`service_class` indicates class identifier for each service index (service index `0` is always control, so it's
skipped in this enumeration).
The command form can be used to induce report, which is otherwise broadcast every 500ms.

contents.name: noop
contents.description: Do nothing. Always ignored. Can be used to test ACKs.

contents.name: identify
contents.description: Blink an LED or otherwise draw user's attention.

contents.name: reset
contents.description: Reset device. ACK may or may not be sent.

contents.name: device_description
contents.description: Identifies the type of hardware (eg., ACME Corp. Servo X-42 Rev C)

contents.name: firmware_identifier
contents.description: A numeric code for the string above; used to identify firmware images and devices.

contents.name: bootloader_firmware_identifier
contents.description: Typically the same as `firmware_identifier` unless device was flashed by hand; the bootloader will respond to that code.

contents.name: firmware_version
contents.description: A string describing firmware version; typically semver.
